author: Reuters Editorial
title: San Francisco soda warnings case on hold pending Supreme Court ruling
text:
A federal appeals court will hold off on deciding whether to block a San Francisco law mandating health warnings for soda and other sugary drinks until the U.S. Supreme Court rules on a free speech case involving anti-abortion crisis pregnancy centers.
The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in San Francisco issued the order on Thursday after agreeing in January to have all of its 11 active judges review a three-judge panelâ€™s decision blocking the law.
